title: Happy with a service
body: Very caring doctor! I were very happy how he checked a baby ( 9 weeks baby), asked me how I'm feeling and general questions. Thanks to midwife as well, as she opened all baby first immunisation s infront of me, so I can see .

title: Receptionist are very rude
body:
This is probably the worst GP in Essex due their receptionist. They have zero customer care nor telephone ☎️ skills. They speak rudely and always hang up the phone whilest you are talking. I don’t think they should be working with patients -
They must work for a prison Front desk not a Gp.

title: OUTSTANDING CARE
body:
I visited Sussex County Hospital on Monday to have an Endoscopy.
I have to say I've never had such an incredible team of staff/calm experience before. The whole procedure, start to finish was worry free, I felt the staff were going above and beyond to not only follow hygiene rules but to also enable me to feel as calm and safe as possible. They took the time to listen to my concerns and took even more time to reassurance me/make sure all those worries disappeared. 
An endoscopy was something that I was dreading having but they made me feel so calm and safe, so much so I wouldn't be scared if I had to have antoher. 
I wish i could list their names as they truly deserve the recognition. 
Thank you ladies for all that you do!

readBy.name: Digestive Diseases Centre, Royal Sussex County Hospital

title: A&E
body:
A family member is very grateful for the care shown during a recent overnight stay in A&E.

A few pointers:
With the ambulance crew not staying for handover, the receptionists either didn't know about, or had forgotten the patient.
Liquids were provided, but no food.
£10 or so of cash was pilfered.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Rude receptionist!
body: This practice is being run very poorly.  After requesting an emergency supply of medication because they couldn’t schedule an appointment for several weeks, they sent the prescription to the chemist but didn’t tell me they had done so. No email, no call, no text, nothing! On arrival for a physical appointment, the receptionist was exceptionally rude and highly unprofessional.  Overall, it has been an extremely unpleasant experience contacting and dealing with this centre. Lest we all not forget, kindness and good manners cost nothing!!

title: Blood tests
body: New appointment system for blood tests is great. Visited last week 3 Sep, 90 mins wait for turn up and queue, was happy to wait as good weather, many queuing but good experience from volunteer and staff. More bloods needed. New system advised by GP, booked online (simple and quick) for following day, swift, professional service - no more than 10 mins on hospital site. Great solution to the queues, reducing contact time with other patients. Well done!

title: Great care when you need it most
body: I was so impressed with the standard of care I received during a recent medical emergency, even more so considering the pressure the team must be under due to COVID-19. My telephone assessment was efficient, quickly followed up by an appointment in person and subsequent referral to the hospital for surgery all within hours - a scary time for anyone, but I felt so looked after. I have used the practice for over 15 years and would recommend it to anyone.

title: Horrendous
body: The Doctor I saw at the practice, was completely unproffessional, rude and rushed.  The appointment was over an hour late which may explain the doctors attitude, and when I refused a junior doctor sitting in on the examination due to the personal nature of examination, the doctor took offense to this and was completely offensive. This is the first an only appointment as we are changing practice immediately.

title: What are our doctors actually doing ?
body: Shenstone practice remains closed, almost impossible to get an appointment at Lichfield and our doctors apparently too busy.Given our hospitals are nearly empty and there are very few cases of COVID in Lichfield, what are the Westgate doctors actually doing and why are they always unavailable?

title: Brilliant reception team!
body: The receptionists at this practice are absolutely first class. Whenever I call in they will always go out of their way to help me and are super friendly and polite. I have also witnessed how the reception team act with tremendous dignity and composure when having to deal with rude and unreasonable members of the public. Their work does not go unnoticed and our practice would be lost without them!

title: Accident & Emergency Dept and the Acute Medical…
body:
I was admitted to A & E with breathing difficulties then later transferred to Ward J on the Acute Medical Unit, where I spent three nights from 6th - 9th of September, 2020.

Having been diagnosed with bilateral blood clots on my lungs, the nurses and doctors of both departments treated me with great compassion while displaying high levels of professionalism with regards to all aspects of my care. 

Nothing was too much trouble for any of them despite working in sometimes challenging conditions, and their friendly, good natured manner always put myself and others at ease, even when things went sideways. In particular, when I suffered shortness of breath one morning before eventually losing consciousness as the no-doubt tired AMU nurse nearing the end of her night shift was checking my blood pressure and other vital signs, she remained composed throughout (according to onlookers) and after bringing me around went out of her way to ensure I was safe and comfortable before clocking off. (Not wanting to leave out A &E, I will add that during the evening following my transfer upstairs to the AMU, individual A & E doctors came to see me on two separate occasions to reassure and check I was doing ok.)

They are truly wonderful people and I will look back on my brief time in A & E, then as the occupier of bed J40 in the AMU, with fond memories and immense respect for all those who looked after myself and the other patients. Thank you to everyone concerned!

title: Amazing doctor
body: Such a personal physician who is personable and professional.. Extremely competent and knowledgeable. Highly recommended

title: Best surgery in Dunstable
body: I have been to multiple GP surgeries in Dunstable/Houghton Regis and they were all awful in comparison to Priory Gardens. Before the pandemic I could be seen the same day using the sit and wait clinic, I could book an appointment online for the following day and I can always see an empathetic member of staff including the receptionists the nurses and the GP’s. I used to dread going to the doctors but since being registered with Priory for over a year now I actually look forward to it. And the engage consult tool is a life saver and saves me phoning and phoning to get through like I have done in the past. I recommend all my friends and family to priory and none of them have regretted it.

title: Cancel appointments
body:
It took a couple of days of negotiating on the phone to get an appointment with my doctor and then the day of the appointment I get a text saying it’s cancelled.
Why they can’t phone but text so that now I have to spend ages on hold trying to get hold of them again.
This practice is not fit for purpose.

title: Fantastic service
body:
Went here after calling 111 about a suspected kidney infection. Very efficient at the door, waited on car for only a short time, till I got called and
Friendly kind staff that actually listened.  Doctor was very thorough checking urine and bloods.  
Restored my faith in the NHS and Doctors 
Thank you I feel at ease after seeing you all there.

title: Excellent practice
body: I recently had cateract surgery at Spamedica and would thoroughly recommmend this practice for their extremely kind, thoughtful and professional behaviour towards me. Absolutely everything was explained to me, and I was fully reassured throughout the whole process. The clinic is clean and well thought out particularly during these difficult times. All aftercare was given with full and concise instructions. Excellent service all round.

title: It’s ok
body: The clinic itself is ok, however the new app: askmygp is absolutely rubbish. I have been trying all evening and this morning just to sign in so that I could book an appointment and it refuses to accept my password. I was redirected to change my password twice and the app still refused to accept my password until I was eventually locked out. This was after I signed on for ask my gp, I was redirected to patient access. I am really angry and confused right now.

title: Bad practice
body:
Book you in to see wrong doctor and when you complaint they say you are being rude .
They have a no care attitude, also they blame c19 for unnecessary errors.

title: Disgusting Receptionist
body:
When being on redial since 8am I finally got through to make an appointment and I was greated with an extremely disgusting attitude informing me the appointments had all gone. After trying to ask some questions to see if there was a way I could see anyone she continued to reply in a snappy aggressive manner. 

The public certainly do not deserve to be spoken to like this, no matter how stressful this role may be. I asked for her name and she foully refused. 

In absolute disgust with how I've just been received when calling to for help with my health.

title: Great hospital
body: I attended your hospital after breaking my elbow.  I would like to say thank you to all the staff for looking after me.  You were all so kind, caring and professional.  Thanks again.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lovely reception staff
body: This week i have been poorly With  a chest infection (NOT CORONA!) The receptionists have been so patient with me and very kind and reassuring ! Would recommend anybody to go to this doctors , as long  as you treat them with respect they are more than happy to help you as much as they can. Especially during this pandemic ! Things are hard on a norm let alone with a worldwide pandemic.

title: Going downhill
body:
This used to be a really useful surgery but recently they seem to have some serious problems. I think they have overstretched their capacity.

Like most surgeries they have moved to telephone consultations due to COVID. They have also suspended the walk-in service. I tried to phone today (and yesterday) to arrange a repeat prescription (they are unable to get their online service working for me). The automated line told me there is an estimated waiting time of 20 minutes.

This is at 9:00 am, 2:00 pm and 5:00 pm. They clearly need some more receptionists.

title: Horrible, rude and extremely unbothered…
body: Can hardly ever get through to reception and when you do there’s never any appointments they always tell you to call at 8am for an appointment but when you do even then you get told there is none. Can never get a repeat prescription and the receptionists have no telephone manners, always putting the phone down and letting it ring out. Extremely unreliable doctors surgery and has been for the past few years.

title: Continues to give exemplary patient care
body:
In these uncertain times it is hard to find positives,especially if you have health problems
The team at Church Walk continue to be patient centric,in spite of ever changing Government advice
They are professional whilst showing great caring and empathy 
Well done & THANK YOU

title: Rude Receptionists  - Rude Staff - Uninterested…
body: Stay away if you can. Unfortunately this practice has very rude staff and the ladies at the reception are never friendly.

title: Very helpful
body: Quick call back and good use of switching to video call for visual check up. Happy with the information provided by the doctor. Was helpful to be encouraged to contact again if symptoms persist.

title: Above and beyond care
body: I was an inpatient in June to have a scheduled total knee replacement which had been cancelled in March due to Covid. I would like to say i received the most wonderful care during my stay all the the staff worked very hard with great care and empathy nothing was to much for them. My knee replacement is a total success and i would like to thank everyone who cared for me in the Orthopedic dept.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Excellent treatment
body: Admitted for hip replacement through NHS and found the whole procedure excellent. All staff were friendly, knowledgeable and professional and operation and involved procedures first class. I felt fully involved throughout and my opinion always taken into consideration. Room extremely clean and all staff observed health & safety procedures re Covid. Catering first class.

title: Radiotherapy staff
body: Spent 3 weeks in August back and forth to the radiotherapy dept at Lincoln. It's very daunting to begin with but the staff are absolutely brilliant. They always explained what was going to happen and answered any questions. They were kind, caring and very accommodating, exactly what was needed in the clinically 'space age' surroundings of the treatment room. It was very surreal and yet another 'first' that you come across along the path of cancer treatment. The whole department (including receptionists and non clinical staff) supported me brilliantly - every single one of you is a credit to the hospital trust. Well done!

title: Endocrinology nurses are amazing
body: Having suffered with hyperthyroidism and Graves’ disease for over a year now I must admit that the endocrine nurses are simply amazing. They’ve provided me with great support and I feel very safe in their hands. They always have time for me and are more than happy to test my bloods if I’m ever feeling off or concerned. Thank you ladies. It’s a wonderful experience being under your care during such a difficult time

readBy.name: Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Thereals
title: Nottingham city and county south crisis team
body: Telephone line is available 24 hours for people suffering acute and severe symptoms arising from ongoing mental illnesses. Over a year ago I made a complaint about an individual’s conduct and manner towards me. I really wished I hadn’t because I believe such a decision has prejudiced me against the service. The person who I made the complaint about was still able to take calls from vulnerable people such as myself. I have no problem with that. It’s just whenever I phone up the service (which is not often, only phoning on 2 occasions this year) and this person answers the phone I get the phone slammed down on me without any enquiry as to the state of my mental health. It is so humiliating and demeaning especially considering the lockdown of help from my primary mental health team and my GP since March of this. Don’t want to carry on writing this it’s just to upsetting for me

title: Highly Recommended
body: I’ve been with Kirkburton health practice over four years. I suffer mental health issues which I’ve found difficult to live with at times. My experience with the practice has been positive from day one. The stigma around mental health does not exist at Kirkburton. The admin team are responsive and compassionate. I don’t feel judged or embarrassed when talking with them. They listen, they offer solutions, they connect you with a doctor or a nurse if necessary, they work very well with the medical staff. Continuity is excellent. They do not pass you from doctor to doctor. I’ve not always been easy to talk to or help (unfortunately my illness can make me ‘hard work’) and the patience of the admin team is worth its weight in gold. The doctors and nurses are consistent and focused, and having continuity with my doctor is hugely important for me, which is something the whole practice works hard to ensure is maintained. My gratitude and appreciation of the office and reception staff, the doctors and nurses, is beyond measure. A brilliant practice staffed by a group of people that definitely place the safety and well being of their patients as their priority, and their understanding and management of mental health within and throughout the practice is outstanding.

title: Excellent Practice
body:
My name is (Mrs.)Marilyn Gibbons , from the begging of April I lost 1.5 kg stone due to numerous medical problems.
Covid-19 made it very difficult to see any Doctor and then registered with the Newham Medical Centre and spoke to the staff who were very helpful and professional .I started feeling better with this outstanding service which they were delivering.Although I haven't seen a doctor face to face yet I have every confidence that this Medical Practice will get to the bottom of my problems during this very difficult times that we are all facing.I have nothing but prays for all the staff at Newham Medical Centre.Thank you all very much.

title: Excellent but waiting area was not covid-19 safe
body:
I visited the QEII Urgent Care Centre on 5 September 2020 and received a very quick, efficient and professional medical service. However I was completely shocked to find that the seating in the waiting area was not Covid-19 safe. Even though some seats were not in use, the side-by-side separation was about 1 metre and front to back was nil. Yet there are notices on the walls saying you should keep 2 metres apart!

What I found even more strange is both staff and other patients seemed to oblivious to this proximity problem.

title: Horrified
body:
I cannot believe you have taxi drivers wandering in and out of your building during Covid 19
Picking up passengers all day long then entering your building to collect patients 
Escorting them to taxis without any medical training whatsoever 
If they trip slip or worse catch Covid or heart attack who they claiming off the taxi driver??
Baffled as to why you would allow dozen and dozens of different drivers per day to enter

readBy.name: Greater Manchester Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor practice
body: I have been waiting for an ENT appointment For 2 months now following a referral which was apparently made by one of Crown Medical GP’s.  As this was an over the phone consultation I have no idea wether this referral was actually made and spend most nights in pain waiting to be seen by ENT not knowing if I will ever be seen.  I was supposed to have bloods and I haven’t even had an appointment through for these either.

title: Wonderful experience.
body: Had reason to call 111.  Ambulance arrived in 30min and I was treated within 5mins of attending A&E.  Cannot thank ambulance nurses, nurses in A&E and doctors for the care and attention that was given to me.  Nothing was too much trouble to ensure that I was calm and comfortable.   We are blessed with wonderful, caring staff at all levels in this area.  God bless you all and keep you safe during these difficult times.

title: appalling service
body:
I will be running out of my medication very shortly so I have tried to organise simple repeat prescription. Or one would think it might be easy.
2 days ago it took me around 5 hours to get to speak with someone from the call centre, only to be told there were no appointments left! and that I should try calling tomorrow at 8am, presumably when every other patient will be trying to get through.
I took the advice and called at 8am, obviously engaged, and so on until around 10.45 when I was put in a queue, I joined at number 7, waited 30 minutes approx, only to be told when I was Number 1, that there were no more appointments.
(Did it really take 30 minutes to tell the 6 people in front of me that there were no appts?)
Surely there's a better way to get repeats?
I was also told to go online and complain, I think I may have used the online service for appointments once, a few years back, so naturally I didn't have the password, and the chance to reset it proved useless so I hit another brick wall.
The service when you get through to a GP is fine enough, but all the nonsense along the way trying to get a slot (a phone appt by the way) far outweighs anything and just makes you want to give in. But if it wasn't for my GP insisting that I take this medicine prescribed I probably wouldn't bother trying doggedly, patiently calling again tomorrow to go through the same race to be number 1 in the queue! 
Appalling set up, appalling way to run what used to be a good practice.

title: A great place for a cataract operation
body: I did go 0n 4th of April for a check and thet were very efficient they told me that I need a cataract operation and they will do the right eye first as the wright eye is worce than the left I asked how long will have to wait and they told me with 2 weeks but, because the covid19 the goverment put a stop of all nonurgent operation. when they were aloud to do the operation I had a telephone call and gave me a date of 29th july which they came and collected me and got me beck home because I dint have anybody to take me or bring me back home as my home was 30 miles away. They were very thourough  and carried the gides very well. Im waiting now to have the left eye and looking forward of going again to soamedica as the waiting time is very short. exellent care while there and after you I got home

title: Very Supportive
body: I went through Trauma, Assessment and Short Stay Wards over two days. In each case it was clear that staff were very busy but they were professional and had good people skills. They asked many questions on several occasions and ran continuous tests. At all times I felt they were in full control which made me feel comfortable given the circumstances. In most cases they were all very friendly and responded well to the little humour that I could muster. I should like to add that the same comments apply to the ambulance crew who attended me and took me to the QA.

title: FIRST CLASS AND CARING PRACTICE
body:
My family and i have been with this practice for over 50 years, and during all that time I can honestly say we have been fortunate enough to have first class service from the Partners, together with Nursing staff, and all the Reception staff, who being at the forefront at all times have been excellent, and always try their utmost to listen and help with any problems. I cannot at this very difficult time for everyone recommend all at Richmond Surgery high enough.  My thanks to each and every one of you. 
Joan Hall.

title: Great consultation
body: GP provided clear, concise information about my condition in easy-to-understand language. Answered all my questions with a reassuring manner. That, in itself helped in addition to the medication prescribed.

title: Not great
body: Hard to get an appointment, telephone callbacks never happen, rude staff, rarely feel ‘heard’ at this gp. Would not recommend

title: Shocking practice
body:
I genuinely struggle to see what service this practice offers in reality. GP appointments are non existent - I’m aware there is a shortage but when speaking to people who use other practices in Tamworth, they don’t have any problems providing you are happy to see any doctor rather than a specific one - which is completely reasonable. So many times we had to go to minor injuries over the years as they are just quite frankly useless. I struggle to see what they offer to the community as a whole. 

If people can’t access services and it’s beyond the level of a pharmacist, they will simply end up using other services within the NHS system such as A&E.

I’d think long and hard about using this practice, they offer no service. Go to one of the other surgeries in the area.

title: Bad/irresponsible advice from doctor
body: My 18 year old son had a telephone consultation with a doctor At this practice this morning as he has been very unwell with huge throat glands and red sore throat with yellow spots. The doctor told him to take paracetamol and ibuprofen. At the end of the conversation he was told “for future reference don’t call the doctor about this”. What?!?! I think this is extremely bad and irresponsible advice, given a lot of young men are very reluctant to seek medical advice and in cases of swollen throats it can be a number of nasty causes. Once again, another disappointing service from this practice. Time to change doctors.

title: Great staff but...
body: The services provided by Machen Eye Unit are very good and staff are lovely. However, I've been extremely frustrated recently as I have an eye surgery to do and they keep cancelling in the last minute. I understand they might have a list of priority, but if that's the case, I think they should just say it, or tell the patients they will get in touch when they have availability. The surgery has been cancelled twice in a row, and they literally called me 2h before the appointment time. The reason was the same: the machine has broken. Really? What a coincidence, I must be very unlucky as the machine broke on the specific dates they booked me in. I planned to have the day off, and they gave me very short notice twice. I wonder now if I'll have this surgery done. It's just really frustrating. As I said, I wouldn't mind if in my first appointment the doctor had informed me the hospital is very busy and they would call me when they have a date. But the expectation is what frustrates me and short notice.

title: Poor communication, admin and general care
body:
Sadly I have very little good to say here.  My NHS referral went through pre lockdown but then the appointment was cancelled as expected.  When rebooked the hospital made a huge data error and had booked in another person with the same name as me and I only found out because the hospital called the optician to check he had referred the correct person!!  
The letter that they sent is basic and has none of the new Covid precautions on it, which includes a check at the door and that you shouldn't go wearing your own mask.  I wore my own one and promptly was told to throw it in the bin - what a waste!  If I'd known beforehand I wouldn't have worn it.  Inside the staff were ok, but a bit surly at times, just as a comparison the NHS hospital equivalent are very friendly and polite.  The procedure (YAG) was only done on 1 eye even though the advice of the optician was for both.  Very little in the way of aftercare advice and not given a follow up or check just told to see my optician in around a week.  I sadly cannot recommend this hospital, I realise they are taking on the extra work from the NHS but they do not have the same level of efficiency or care as our wonderful NHS hospitals do.  Wish I'd been referred to Moorfields as my optician requested.

title: On hold for just under 2 hours
body:
I was on hold for 1 hour and 50 minutes, so just under 2 hours, trying to get through to Moorfields At St Georges.
There is absolutely NO justification for this. We have jobs too you know, that’s 2 hours out of my working day.
The man who answered was rude and belligerent to boot when I quite reasonably asked if there was any reason for this.

title: Chemotherapy staff
body: Received 2 cycles of chemo in March at the Pilgrim hospital then all chemo treatment was moved to Grantham hospital. Had a further 4 cycles there but was so pleased that all the staff from Boston were there as well - nice to see their smiling faces. It was all quite frightening to begin with but the nurses helped settle me into a nice little routine. All of them were polite, helpful, knowledgeable, kind and caring - it would be unfair to mention specific names as they all worked as a team - but there are a few of you who helped treat my husband only 12 months before and I was treated like one of the family! Such a shame I had to meet these fantastic people in these circumstances but I couldn't have got through it without you. All the relevant precautions were taken with regard to covid so I did not feel at risk at any time, I was just extremely grateful the treatment was continued through lockdown. Thank you, thank you so much - nurses, health care assistants, receptionists, everyone in the unit - you were brilliant and a credit to the NHS!

title: Very good and caring practice
body: Staff are caring as you feel they have the time for you whether on the phone or in person. Never had a bad experience from the dr. or any of the team.

title: Outstanding
body: I was very nervous and apprehensive about my cataract operation. I attended SpaMedica in Bolton and from the assessment to the actual operation I was very impressed with the professionalism and friendly approach from Reception to Medical staff who put me at ease every step of the way.

title: Great Customer Service
body:
I needed some assistance from this practice recently.
This note is to recognise the top rate customer service and, in particular, the friendly and helpful manner displayed at reception.

title: A team to be proud of!
body: Well done York hospital A and E Department! Wonderful, patient and understanding staff that made me feel very comfortable and relaxed which made all the difference due to the circumstances of coronavirus. Even my husband (who wasn’t allowed in to see me) was spoken to by a member of staff and his mind put to rest that I was being given the best possible care. Nothing was too much trouble and the attention that was given to me felt very personal. Thank you for taking care of me.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Eye A&E
body: Turned up and was seen really quickly. Lovely staff and excellent emergency service. Given prescription medication quickly.

title: Very good Service and Great Staff
body:
From referral to treatment I can not fault the service. They helped me learn techniques to manage my anxiety. 

Thank you to all the staff in their lovely admin team and also the therapists.

title: Very caring and understanding staff
body: This is my second experience at this department and feeling nervous the two nurses were very quick to reassure and talk to me taking my mind off the procedure. The second visit was exactly the same and just wanted to say a very big Thankyou for being such caring people. The lovely cup of tea was very nice too and a well needed one . Thankyou again all of you from the start at reception right through to the consultant.

title: Marie Celeste style communication
body: I have been trying for a week solid to contact the surgery. No answer ever comes and they put the phone down after a set time. It would be nice to get hold of at least somebody or I will have to visit the surgery in person, which is against what they requested last time they actually answered.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Absolute rubbish
body: You cant make appointments here because their  phone lines are not working at all!! When you visit the practice they tell you to call back. Therefore no option to make appointment. Would avoid this place for sure !!!!!!

title: Disappointed
body:
I had an appointment at Horfield Health Centre yesterday. My baby, who is 8 weeks old, had her "6 weeks check"with the GP. The doctor did not weight her (I still do not know why because, according to the staff, the doctor should have done it). When I got home I called them to use the scale today since I had to go again for the immunisations. The staff told me I could use the scale at 10:30 and after that, at 10:50, my baby would have the immunisations.
This morning I was there to use it as they told me the day before. There was no scale because apparently the doctors were using them to do the "6 weeks check" so the staff told me I could use the scale after the immunisations. When they finished with my baby I went to the main desk to ask again for the scale...but there was not scale so the staff told me to come back the next day. I was very surprised and disappointed because the did not do anything to help me. It seemed they did not care. I understand the situation is very complicated due to covid 19 and for that reason I am not able to understand why they asked me to go on three diffrerent days.... with a baby!
I am deeply disappointed with the way they have treated my baby and I.

title: Very disappointed
body: I needed to see a GP face to face Urgently according to another GP and the receptionists kept me waiting for 6 hours without calling or giving information. I do understand it is a difficult time but if GP says something they are not the ones that need to decide anything. They should listen to GPs and inform patients. I feel so let down by them. If we can’t trust surgeries then what are we going to do? Very very disappointed with the way they treated me. I do hope they can review their protocols and have some more training in terms of talking to patients.

title: poor service
body: Whilst i fully understand the pressures of covid 19 on GP services i have found (along with the many reviews on google) that there is no chance of booking an appointment at the practice as the phones arent answered. As someone with diabetes i was sent a text asking me to contact the surgery to book an apt for my flu jab. tried - day 1,  5 times and was as the day went on 19th, 24th, 30th 43rd in the queue - no answer at all and each time eventually just says call cant be answered and hangs up, next day 24th, 35th, 24th, 19th and eventually 13th when i waited 45 mins again but did finally get through. This is not only extremely time consuming as i waited over 45 mins each time before the call was hung up by the surgery but these calls are also expensive. why can an apt not be sent direct to us or book online. i know many people who have had the same issue with contacting the surgery and the feedback on google shows that many of us are unhappy.

title: Practice phoneline unavailable
body: Have been trying to get through to Ashgate practice for test results for a week. Phone line gives unobtainable tone or constantly engaged. Tried booking an appointment on-line, system is down. Not allowed to attend surgery without an appointment. What are you supposed to do??

title: Very poor service. Can never get an appointment.
body:
Text by surgery to make a blood pressure and blood sample appointment. Phoned the Crownhill surgery ( which has been our surgery for many years ) However since Pathfields group has taken over can never get through. I have now spent 4 hours on the phone trying to get through. If I could get another surgery near me, I would instantly change. 
I booked a flu jab and yet have had to travel to the other side of Plymouth. This is no short journey when you and your partner are in our late sixties and both have medical problems and need to catch buses.
This was explained to the staff, yet made no difference.
Come on Pathfields, get your act together.
Read other reviews to see how badly your patients think you are doing.

title: Very rude phone reception
body: I phoned to make an appointment for flu vaccination in response to a letter from the practice. Person I spoke with after waiting for nearly twenty minutes made no attempt to listen or engage with me, just spoke over me at length and hung up. Very rude and not called for. This used to be a friendly practice but something seems to have changed for the worse this year.

title: eConsult service
body: On Tuesday evening I used the eConsult service for the first time and it was relatively quick and easy to use.  On Wednesday morning a GP contacted me by 9.20am by text.  I was asked a few questions to which I replied and sent a photo and by 9.45 a prescription was sent to the pharmacy fo me. I thought this was an excellent service and worked very well for me. I will definitely use this service again

title: Care? No
body:
The phone line is all but inaccessible.  Website appointment function is unfathomable.

Care?  No not really.

title: Rude and unhelpful reception staff
body: I telephoned and was 1st in the queue for 25 minutes before the call was answered with a "New Folly Surgery, what do you want?" - WHO answers the phone like that??? I needed to bring in a water sample, requested by a nurse, didn't know if I had to hand over at door or book appointment with her. Gave very short, rude, offhand responses to my genuine query of why she thought I needed to see a doctor - with earliest appointments starting w.c. 21st September. Asked for her name, refused to give it when I said I intended to complain about her manner. So ok for her to speak to public how she wants but won't be held accountable. Prior to this never had any trouble with this practice and had heard negative comments - now I'm afraid I have to add to them. There is no excuse to treat the public like this - as if we're an annoyance for needing medical care.

title: What a relief!
body: So glad to have had my second eye done at Wolverhampton. I was put at my ease by being able to chat to the surgeon all the way through. There was no discomfort at all. Everyone I saw was amazing. Great after care too.

title: well organised
body: vulnerable flu clinic very well organised didnt have to wait. Drove into car park had jab in arm and out within 5 minutes

title: Excellent new  Website and ...
body: .. super kind, promptly reacting colleagues who are a pleasure to talk to and deal with.  Always loved Chiddingfold Surgery even though l haven't been often (thankfully).  The experience and 'sorted' way things are done is refreshing.  Thank you so much.

title: Very bad experience
body:
Very bad communication with the receptionist ..express how unhappy I am with the way that the reception lady talk to me with.. I know that this period for all of us is very stressful specially the medical staff but this is not a reason to be treated others patients this way.
My complaint is I was calling yesterday because I need to speak to a doctor and after 20 minutes of waiting she answered me and told me to call tomorrow which is today .. then I called today and the same story after being waiting 20 minutes she told me to call tomorrow and when I was about to explain to her that was told me yesterday and I can’t every day call she said to “ you leave me talk or you will talk over me” .. I was really surprised by the way she was talking to me as my right is to explain and to be heard ... and this wasn’t the first time by the way ... another day I was asking about my blood test result and asked to be sent to me by mail and she refuse without telling me the reason as through this time we are not allowed to go to the practice and have a print copy .. and third time when I was asking if my referral to do a scan was processed or not yet she was very upset 
This Is my simplest right is to be treated like human being : need some one to speak with patient and to me politely and explain to me

title: Helped me a lot
body: Overall A&E were fabulous and helped me greatly with what had happened to me - however, I've been trying to get in contact over the last couple of days as I have no substantial recollection of what it was that led me to A&E, and for obvious reasons no family/friends are allowed in with you so no one can necessarily help, and no one is answering the phone/email to let me know what it was that happened.

title: Quick Service
body:
Attended the "Shielding" Flu Jab clinic this morning
   Well set up and quick.   I was there only about 5 minutes and most of that time involved parking the car!   Very good.

Malcolm Cruise

title: SORT IT OUT.
body: worst gp health center. they never answer their phone. i waited almst half n hour for them to answer. What is going on with this center. it got good and now is terrible. thankfully I moved a week ago because whole systems is bad. also very arrogant supervisor/manager who took my call cause i wanted to make complaint.

title: Not fit for purpose
body: Tried to make appointment for flu vaccination only given one date could not make that day told to try phamacy as we are in our seventys and thought older age groups were a priority obviously got that wrong recently tried to get appointment to see doctor more chance of meeting the pope

title: First Class Emergency Service
body:
I cannot thank the Doctors & Nursing staff enough. I and my wife are so grateful to you all including Surgeons who operated on me. Seeing the photograph of my problem without your professionalism and quick action I would not be here, and I realise that. I also thank you for your concern as to how we would manage with my wife getting over Chemotherapy, but we are fine, with good neighbours and our son would come up from Devon if necessary. Once again we thank you from the bottom of our hearts for a prompt & efficient service,this includes the Ambulance Service. Please keep safe, all of you. You have our deepest respect, thank you,
            Raymond & Maureen PHIPP.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Top class Practice
body: Was in great pain for 6 weeks managed to see Dr who suggested urgent x-ray (still waiting).to cut long story short,After a further 4 weeks was in so much pain (pain killers having no effect) contacted practice who Receptionist  was most helpful saw nurse again 1st class who got me to see a Locum I think,She was the best Dr I have ever seen she hazarded a guess what it was, did blood which came back as she said  result 3 tablets 48 hours later feels like she was working for God and preformed a miracle.Thank you all at practice for care shown

title: lovely team
body: since moving to the surgery two years ago I have had nothing but lovely experiences with all members of the team. Receptionists have been friendly and helpful. The nurses have helped me to feel comfortable and at ease even during smear and blood tests. The Doctors have also been incredibly thorough and helpful at all appointments. I have also always managed to get parked in the surgery car park! a nice bonus for a town centre doctors surgery.

title: revamped practice
body: I visited the revamped surgery for my NHS health check appointment. Firstly I was pleasantly surprised to see the refurbished surgery e.g. brighter clean reception area, more car park spaces, more consulting rooms, refreshments machine. The receptionist was polite and got me seated. The HCA called me in on time. All the health checks were carried out promptly and with care. The HCA explained what will happen when the blood test results are received back. Overall I was very satisfied with the reception and service.

title: Wonderfully kind practice
body: Everyone there treats us as individuals. They are all kind caring people. And they are prompt. No long wait for an appointment.

title: Poor dispensary
body: Going on an extended holiday I needed to double my prescription. Having experienced problems before I put my prescription request in on September 2nd for my departure on September 11th.  When I went to Boots to collect a double prescription on September 7th I was only given half of my normal prescription, many items missing, I immediately went to the dispensary at the surgery.  I was told that there would be a new prescription for the missing items and and another prescription for the next month.  When I went to boots today, September 10th, all that was there was the missing part of my prescription.  It is too late now to do anything about it but buy my own tablets abroad.  I would just like this noted as this seems to be a concern that happens a lot when ordering a double prescription.

title: rude and obstructive
body: I am so disappointed in this surgery I needed to get my unwell 10year son seen and despite pleads they would not help . I called 111 and they said to phone them back and they said I was lying and 111 did not advise that . I've never been so upset all I want is for my to be reviewed as I am worried he has an underlying bowel problem . what does it take to get to see a doctor . the last thing I want to do to do is go to a/e and risk him getting infections when he needs to see gp . the service is a disgrace with rude obstructive reception staff

title: No complaints
body: I have never had cause to complain regarding this practice. Kind and professional reception staff, and practice manager and great doctors. I couldn't be happier with the care I get here.

title: Patient telephone interface
body:
When was this interface last updated ?
I feel like ending my call after listening to the stuttering 'music' for 10 minutes.
I do not want to wait to speak to a 'representative'
but rather to a receptionist or a member of the surgery staff !
These comments are meant to be helpful - over the years I have found most staff to be considerate and helpful.

title: They just hang up
body: You can call as many times as you want, listen to all the bumpf, and then when you eventually get through to the switch board they just pick up and hang up, repeatedly. Completely unacceptable.

title: Very good, would recommend
body: Very impressive care all around -- have always been able to get a same-day appointment either in person or over the phone, all the staff I've interacted with have been wonderful, the online service seems to work well and has enabled me to manage my prescriptions with relative ease.

title: Great practice
body: The team, from reception to nurses and doctors, is patient, nice, and caring. They listen to patients and are always very clear with their assessment and the next steps of your journey.

title: Fantastic Doctor
body: The Doctor I saw today at Berrow campus put my mind at rest regarding my Diabetes problem, he gave advice, showed interest in my concerns, he reassured me and said he pass on my concerns regarding my Diabetes, I have my Hb1c test next week., then a consultation on the phone soon after with a Diabetic nurse, he even suggested a book that could help me,this reassured me they will help me with my health problem. It was great to find someone so generally interested in my health concerns, it was lovely to talk to someone and be listened to.

title: Disappointed
body: After always loving St Cross following a long term stay when I was younger I was relaxed to know I was to have a pelvic ultrasound here today. I was hugely disappointed with the unsympathetic sonographer at my appointment. I suffer from health anxiety and needed a friendly face, of which I did not get! I have previously had the same procedure at SWIFT and the team were so empathetic and reassuring. This lady made me feel so uncomfortable and even more worried than when I walked in the building. My anxiety has since been through the roof!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Beautiful service
body: I experienced such a warm, friendly and reassuring visit thanks to all the staff involved.

title: Reception staff need to improve listening to…
body: Third time my call was taken by a member of staff who showed no empathy (the three times), no listening skills and seemed to be just interested in a script. When you answer the call, you need to listen, don't be defensive, you need to understand what the patient is requiring & be polite. None of this in this person. I asked to speak to the manager & I was declined this. I went in person to the surgery & apparently the manager was talking to me. If all your calls are recorded, you better listen to it & you will understand that understanding what the patient is requesting rather than saying it is someone else's problem. Literally. I had already 2 issues in the past & today staff did not seem to care about me as a patient. I am angry & very disappointed, because you have good doctors & some other good staff at the reception, but because of a few and very bad admin, I am taking the time to write this because you made me upset and you should not upset patients, you should be helping them to get their medication or treatments

title: Fantastic and professional team
body: I just wanted to say a big thank you to the clinic. I came in for a routine IUD change and everyone was lovely, professional, and friendly. Social distancing is in place in the waiting room and it was really clear where to go and what to do. The doctor took the time to clearly explain everything to me, even though I had had it done before, and talked me through the whole procedure both beforehand and as it was happening. She was very careful and immediately responsive to times when I was physically uncomfortable. The nurse was also lovely, checking in on me and making sure I had everything I needed. I felt very safe and looked after, which you really appreciate when it's such an intimate procedure. I can't thank you enough.

readBy.name: Central and North West London Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: Responsive GP service, especially in the context of Covid. They were very helpful and I’m pleased. Thank you!

title: Long overdue improvement!
body: The last 3 time’s I’ve called I have been offered an appointment on the same day! Lots of new doctors and nurses which means I can actually be seen. The building looks impressive inside and out. Can you get more fish as the one on its own looks lonely. Recommend the practice. Well done

title: Great practice
body:
Had to go for bloods/ECG 
Nurse was lovely , very reassuring
Appt on time 
ECG reviewed by Dr - all good 
This practice has been consistently good over the years we have been with them. Never had a problem with accessing appropriate appointments etc .Available 8-8 7 days which is better than most 
Thankyou

title: On hold....
body:
Pointless doctor... They must have one person answering the phones for all surgeries. I've had my blood test to check my thryoid levels. I can tell my medication dose is wrong hence the test... No matter when I call I'm number 13 or 15 in the queue... The queue goes down so slow. As I work as a teacher I don't have hours to wait on the phone. No weekend opening currently..6pm they cut the phonelines and drop the call! I've downloaded the NHS sandwell and Birmingham app and have limited access until this GP clicks a button... Waiting weeks for them to do that. As I leave this review nothing...

Pointless GP! Looking for a new one that actually answers the phone. Frustrated!

title: Efficient, Kind & Caring Staff
body:
A short while after being referred to the Pain Management Team by I was telephoned by a very pleasant member of that team. He spoke to me with respect throughout & listened to everything I had to say, & throughout the conversation I never felt rushed. He courteously corrected my belief that my back pain was due to an injury I had over 40 years ago. This got me thinking in a different way about how to manage my chronic back pain. I have always kept very positive about this pain & over the years learned how to deal with it so that it didn't rule my life . I received a huge amount of information & websites from the team (some of which was a bit heavy going), but some was very good, such as how to desensitize the pain & learning that the pain is very real & not "in my head" & that it was due to my nervous system, not the injury.  A further phone call from a different member of the team helped me with the emotional aspect of living with back pain. We got on well. In the mean time a lady phoned to invite me to join a Zoom session which I declined as I couldn't make such a big commitment of a whole morning for 6 weeks. This member of the team was also very kind & caring. My mental attitude improved over the months of lock down mainly due to losing quite a lot of weight, which had a great positive impact on my painful joints. After a follow up phone call I was sent more websites to look at with loads more information & useful exercises. I was again invited to join the Zoom group, but again declined as I felt I didn't really need that level of support. After a final phone it was agreed that I should be discharged, with the understanding that I knew that they would help me in the future, should I need it. It would have been nice to see someone in person, but of course that wasn't possible due to the global situation we all find ourselves in. The only slight negative I found in the short time I spent with the team was that I felt it was all a bit of " do it yourself". I am sure this was due to the way they have to work at this time. I am sure that  pre Covid, I wouldn't have felt this way, so this is no reflection on the Team.  I am a positive, active person & am coping. I feel for others that are really struggling with life restricting chronic pain. I hope that are able to cope with this remote way of support. I am sure the team are fully aware of the need for "face to face" support & will return to working in this way as soon as they can.  Many thanks to all the team.
Julie Edge

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Very satisfied patient
body:
I have nothing but praise for this surgery.at the way I have been treated at this differcult  time. I phone the surgery to speak to a Dr.
The Dr phoned me up within half  an hour, then got me to come to  the surgery to see the paramedic.I was told I needed a blood test.
I had the blood test a few days later.   3 days after the blood test
The Dr phoned me at home with the results.
I know it is very flustrating for patients not being able to see Dr,s
face to face at this difficult time.
I am very satisfied at the way the receptionist  paramedic and the 
Doctor all treated me.Many thanks to you all

title: Brilliant staff
body: I went in for minor surgery on my hand, and was very impressed with the Nurses and Doctor that treated me. All of them were friendly, made me feel comfortable and were all brilliant at their jobs. My surgery went ahead without a hitch, was very quick and successful, and they even made me a brew afterwards. Awesome people!

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful experience.
body: I’m reluctant to leave a bad review about the NHS because it serves us so well. But this GP surgery is unbelievably dreadful. I called 140 times just to get an appointment, and even then I was given the wrong information meaning I couldn’t pick up my prescription. The reception staff were unbelievably rude, unhelpful and downright awful. I had to fight nail and tooth over the phone just to get some emergency medication to see me through. Even then, one of the receptionists hung the phone up on me before I had finished talking meaning I had to ring back irritable angry and frustrated at the way I was being treated. It is absolutely disgusting. Just to top it all off I was phoned back by a doctor who said they would send my prescription over to a pharmacy that was open late night in order for me to pick it up. When I got to the pharmacy I was told nothing had been sent over and due to the GP surgery already being closed there was nothing they could do. There needs to be a major overhaul of the working practices at this pharmacy because they are absolutely diabolical and left me in pain, upset and frustrated. Not representative of the NHS at all.
